action.action-desc: Ms. Brownley (for herself, Mr. Landsman, Ms. Norton, Ms. Elfreth, Mrs. Cherfilus-McCormick, Ms. Williams of Georgia, Mr. Carson, Ms. Simon, Ms. Budzinski, Ms. Jayapal, Mrs. Sykes, Mr. Pocan, Ms. Chu, Mr. Thanedar, and Mrs. McIver) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

form.official-title: To amend title 5, United States Code, to require agencies to provide official personnel record files to Federal employees and former Federal employees, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Protecting Federal Employee Rights to Personnel Files Act of 2025.

section.header: Requirement to provide official personnel record files to employees and former employees

subsection.text: Subchapter I of chapter 33 of title 5, United States Code, is amended by inserting after section 3330f the following:

section.header: Requirement to provide official personnel record files to employees and former employees

subsection.text: Not later than seven days after the date an employee of an agency requests a copy of the employee’s official personnel record file, the head of such agency shall provide to such employee, in electronic and physical form, a copy of such file.

paragraph.text: With respect to any employee separating from an agency on or after the date of the enactment of this section, not later than seven days after the date of such separation, the head of such agency shall provide to such employee, in electronic and physical form, a copy of the employee’s official personnel record file.

With respect to any individual who separated from an agency before the date of the enactment of this section, not later than 21 days after the date such an individual requests a copy of the employee’s official personnel record file from the Director of the Office of Personnel Management, the Director shall provide, in electronic and physical form, a copy of such file to the individual.

subsection.text: In this section, the term agency has the meaning given that term in section 551.
The table of sections for such subchapter is amended by inserting after the item relating to section 3330f the following:

toc.toc-entry: 3330g. Requirement to provide official personnel record files to employees and former employees.
